definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: " The hard-liners, he says, have learned "a very tough lesson.
sentences.chinese: “强硬派，他说，学会了”一个非常艰难的一课。

sentences.english: The first we'll call the hard-liners.
sentences.chinese: 我们将第一类称为强硬派。

sentences.english: The social consequences could be disastrous, and could give political hard-liners a leg up.
sentences.chinese: 其社会后果可能是灾难性的，同时会触怒强硬派分子。

sentences.english: China- bashers have introduced a dozen bills in the new Congress.
sentences.chinese: “对华强硬派”议员已经向国会提交了十二分议案。

sentences.english: It is a pity, the Kuomintang hardliner destroyed this path finally.
sentences.chinese: 遗憾的是，国民党强硬派最终破坏了这一道路。

sentences.english: And there is still the hardy minority that insists on viewing the Beatles as the great put-on of the century.
sentences.chinese: 还有一些少数强硬派认定披头士是本世纪最大的骗子。

sentences.english: The Maoists froth at the extreme fringe of the hardline camp.
sentences.chinese: 毛主义分子在强硬派阵营的极端边缘大喊大叫。

sentences.english: now another tough-talking centre-right party has won in Portugal (see article).
sentences.chinese: 现在另外一个中右的强硬派赢得了葡萄牙的大选。

sentences.english: Hard-liners on China aren't troubled by what the WTO might think.
sentences.chinese: 中国的强硬派并不在意世贸组织会怎么看。
